content.description: Short finger crack that leads to a slab finish. Thanks Sendsai Reinig
content.protection: .1x1 .4x2 and a bouldering pad or top rope from the tree on top of the slab
content.location: Short finger crack about 100m lookers left of the main candlelight wall

climbs.name: Green Gecko
climbs.fa: 1st Anchor: Kerwin & Parker (1985), 2nd Anchor: Bediant & Huckaby (2004), 3rd Anchor: Croft (2005)

content.description:
Green Gecko has no beta in "Bishop Area Rock Climbs" other than 5 stars so we had to go check it out!

1st Anchor: 10a

Climb a very nice finger/wide finger crack in a dihedral.  We thought this felt more like 10b/c.  60ft

2nd Anchor: 11b

Climb past the 1st anchor and into the wide pod.  Exit the pod into a finger-sized layback, and mantle onto the ledge to the right.  100ft

3rd Anchor: 12c

Skip the 2nd anchor and crank through a tips layback underneath a bulge with slick feet.  120ft
content.protection: Doubles to 3", extra small if going to the 3rd anchor.  70m rope.
